newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo aluminium firmer but off highs as dlr eases.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo aluminium firmer but off highs as dlr eases.

text.p: Tokyo aluminium futures ended slightly higher in lacklustre trade on Thursday as the dollar's decline during the day pared initial gains, traders said.
The market opened firmly following overnight gains in London, they said.
"In the short term, aluminium in London looks set to try the upside. But as the yen started to rise (against the dollar) again, prices here are little changed," said a trader.
The dollar remained weak, hovering around 124 yen by late afternoon Tokyo.
TOCOM yen-based aluminium futures ranged from 0.1 yen to 1.8 yen higher, with the benchmark October 1998 contract closing 0.4 yen up at 208.2 yen per kg.
This was in sharp contrast with a strong performance overnight in London, where aluminium prices cleared the $1,640 level triggering an influx of fresh speculative buying.

Traders said most individual investors, who account for the bulk of trade at TOCOM, were currently more interested in investing in grains or precious metals, which have seen larger price fluctuations recently than aluminium.
